intro: Pavetta barbertonensis, commonly known as Barberton pavetta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy surface. It produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
